validator.description: Provides core validation features for JSTL tags.

tag.description: Sets the request character encoding
tag.name: requestEncoding

attribute.description: Name of character encoding to be applied when decoding request parameters.
attribute.name: value

tag.description: Stores the given locale in the locale configuration variable
tag.name: setLocale

attribute.description: A String value is interpreted as the printable representation of a locale, which must contain a two-letter (lower-case) language code (as defined by ISO-639), and may contain a two-letter (upper-case) country code (as defined by ISO-3166). Language and country codes must be separated by hyphen (-) or underscore (_).
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Vendor- or browser-specific variant. See the java.util.Locale javadocs for more information on variants.
attribute.name: variant

attribute.description: Scope of the locale configuration variable.
attribute.name: scope

tag.description: Specifies the time zone for any time formatting or parsing actions nested in its body
tag.name: timeZone

attribute.description: The time zone. A String value is interpreted as a time zone ID. This may be one of the time zone IDs supported by the Java platform (such as "America/Los_Angeles") or a custom time zone ID (such as "GMT-8"). See java.util.TimeZone for more information on supported time zone formats.
attribute.name: value

tag.description: Stores the given time zone in the time zone configuration variable
tag.name: setTimeZone

attribute.description: The time zone. A String value is interpreted as a time zone ID. This may be one of the time zone IDs supported by the Java platform (such as "America/Los_Angeles") or a custom time zone ID (such as "GMT-8"). See java.util.TimeZone for more information on supported time zone formats.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable which stores the time zone of type java.util.TimeZone.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Scope of var or the time zone configuration variable.
attribute.name: scope

tag.description: Loads a resource bundle to be used by its tag body
tag.name: bundle

attribute.description: Resource bundle base name. This is the bundle's fully-qualified resource name, which has the same form as a fully-qualified class name, that is, it uses "." as the package component separator and does not have any file type (such as ".class" or ".properties") suffix.
attribute.name: basename

attribute.description: Prefix to be prepended to the value of the message key of any nested <fmt:message> action.
attribute.name: prefix

tag.description: Loads a resource bundle and stores it in the named scoped variable or the bundle configuration variable
tag.name: setBundle

attribute.description: Resource bundle base name. This is the bundle's fully-qualified resource name, which has the same form as a fully-qualified class name, that is, it uses "." as the package component separator and does not have any file type (such as ".class" or ".properties") suffix.
attribute.name: basename

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable which stores the i18n localization context of type javax.servlet.jsp.jstl.fmt.LocalizationC ontext.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Scope of var or the localization context configuration variable.
attribute.name: scope

tag.description: Maps key to localized message and performs parametric replacement
tag.name: message

attribute.description: Message key to be looked up.
attribute.name: key

attribute.description: Localization context in whose resource bundle the message key is looked up.
attribute.name: bundle

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable which stores the localized message.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Scope of var.
attribute.name: scope

tag.description: Supplies an argument for parametric replacement to a containing <message> tag
tag.name: param

attribute.description: Argument used for parametric replacement.
attribute.name: value

tag.description: Formats a numeric value as a number, currency, or percentage
tag.name: formatNumber

attribute.description: Numeric value to be formatted.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Specifies whether the value is to be formatted as number, currency, or percentage.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: Custom formatting pattern.
attribute.name: pattern

attribute.description: ISO 4217 currency code. Applied only when formatting currencies (i.e. if type is equal to "currency"); ignored otherwise.
attribute.name: currencyCode

attribute.description: Currency symbol. Applied only when formatting currencies (i.e. if type is equal to "currency"); ignored otherwise.
attribute.name: currencySymbol

attribute.description: Specifies whether the formatted output will contain any grouping separators.
attribute.name: groupingUsed

attribute.description: Maximum number of digits in the integer portion of the formatted output.
attribute.name: maxIntegerDigits

attribute.description: Minimum number of digits in the integer portion of the formatted output.
attribute.name: minIntegerDigits

attribute.description: Maximum number of digits in the fractional portion of the formatted output.
attribute.name: maxFractionDigits

attribute.description: Minimum number of digits in the fractional portion of the formatted output.
attribute.name: minFractionDigits

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable which stores the formatted result as a String.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Scope of var.
attribute.name: scope

tag.description: Parses the string representation of a number, currency, or percentage
tag.name: parseNumber

attribute.description: String to be parsed.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Specifies whether the string in the value attribute should be parsed as a number, currency, or percentage.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: Custom formatting pattern that determines how the string in the value attribute is to be parsed.
attribute.name: pattern

attribute.description: Locale whose default formatting pattern (for numbers, currencies, or percentages, respectively) is to be used during the parse operation, or to which the pattern specified via the pattern attribute (if present) is applied.
attribute.name: parseLocale

attribute.description: Specifies whether just the integer portion of the given value should be parsed.
attribute.name: integerOnly

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable which stores the parsed result (of type java.lang.Number).
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Scope of var.
attribute.name: scope

tag.description: Formats a date and/or time using the supplied styles and pattern
tag.name: formatDate

attribute.description: Date and/or time to be formatted.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Specifies whether the time, the date, or both the time and date components of the given date are to be formatted.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: Predefined formatting style for dates. Follows the semantics defined in class java.text.DateFormat. Applied only when formatting a date or both a date and time (i.e. if type is missing or is equal to "date" or "both"); ignored otherwise.
attribute.name: dateStyle

attribute.description: Predefined formatting style for times. Follows the semantics defined in class java.text.DateFormat. Applied only when formatting a time or both a date and time (i.e. if type is equal to "time" or "both"); ignored otherwise.
attribute.name: timeStyle

attribute.description: Custom formatting style for dates and times.
attribute.name: pattern

attribute.description: Time zone in which to represent the formatted time.
attribute.name: timeZone

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable which stores the formatted result as a String.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Scope of var.
attribute.name: scope

tag.description: Parses the string representation of a date and/or time
tag.name: parseDate

attribute.description: Date string to be parsed.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: Specifies whether the date string in the value attribute is supposed to contain a time, a date, or both.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: Predefined formatting style for days which determines how the date component of the date string is to be parsed. Applied only when formatting a date or both a date and time (i.e. if type is missing or is equal to "date" or "both"); ignored otherwise.
attribute.name: dateStyle

attribute.description: Predefined formatting styles for times which determines how the time component in the date string is to be parsed. Applied only when formatting a time or both a date and time (i.e. if type is equal to "time" or "both"); ignored otherwise.
attribute.name: timeStyle

attribute.description: Custom formatting pattern which determines how the date string is to be parsed.
attribute.name: pattern

attribute.description: Time zone in which to interpret any time information in the date string.
attribute.name: timeZone

attribute.description: Locale whose predefined formatting styles for dates and times are to be used during the parse operation, or to which the pattern specified via the pattern attribute (if present) is applied.
attribute.name: parseLocale

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable in which the parsing result (of type java.util.Date) is stored.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Scope of var.
attribute.name: scope

taglib.NAME: permittedTaglibs
taglib.description: Restricts JSP pages to the JSTL tag libraries

init-param.description: Whitespace-separated list of taglib URIs to permit. This example TLD for the Standard Taglib allows only JSTL 'el' taglibs to be imported.

taglib.NAME: scriptfree
taglib.description: Validates JSP pages to prohibit use of scripting elements.

init-param.description: Controls whether or not declarations are considered valid.
Controls whether or not scriptlets are considered valid.
Controls whether or not top-level expressions are considered valid.
Controls whether or not expressions used to supply request-time attribute values are considered valid.

validator.description: Provides core validation features for JSTL tags.

tag.name: transaction
tag.description: Provides nested database action elements with a shared Connection, set up to execute all statements as one transaction.

tag.description: Executes the SQL update defined in its body or through the sql attribute.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Sets a parameter in an SQL statement to the specified value.

tag.name: dateParam
tag.description: Sets a parameter in an SQL statement to the specified java.util.Date value.

tag.name: setDataSource
tag.description: Creates a simple DataSource suitable only for prototyping.

tag.description: Provides nested database action elements with a shared Connection, set up to execute all statements as one transaction.
tag.name: transaction

attribute.description: DataSource associated with the database to access. A String value represents a relative path to a JNDI resource or the parameters for the JDBC DriverManager facility.
attribute.name: dataSource

attribute.description: Transaction isolation level. If not specified, it is the isolation level the DataSource has been configured with.
attribute.name: isolation

tag.description: Executes the SQL query defined in its body or through the sql attribute.
tag.name: query

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable for the query result. The type of the scoped variable is javax.servlet.jsp.jstl.sql. Result (see Chapter 16 "Java APIs").
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Scope of var.
attribute.name: scope

attribute.description: SQL query statement.
attribute.name: sql

attribute.description: Data source associated with the database to query. A String value represents a relative path to a JNDI resource or the parameters for the DriverManager class.
attribute.name: dataSource

attribute.description: The returned Result object includes the rows starting at the specified index. The first row of the original query result set is at index 0. If not specified, rows are included starting from the first row at index 0.
attribute.name: startRow

attribute.description: The maximum number of rows to be included in the query result. If not specified, or set to -1, no limit on the maximum number of rows is enforced.
attribute.name: maxRows

tag.description: Executes the SQL update defined in its body or through the sql attribute.
tag.name: update

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable for the result of the database update. The type of the scoped variable is java.lang.Integer.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Scope of var.
attribute.name: scope

attribute.description: SQL update statement.
attribute.name: sql

attribute.description: Data source associated with the database to update. A String value represents a relative path to a JNDI resource or the parameters for the JDBC DriverManager class.
attribute.name: dataSource

tag.description: Sets a parameter in an SQL statement to the specified value.
tag.name: param

attribute.description: Parameter value.
attribute.name: value

tag.description: Sets a parameter in an SQL statement to the specified java.util.Date value.
tag.name: dateParam

attribute.description: Parameter value for DATE, TIME, or TIMESTAMP column in a database table.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: One of "date", "time" or "timestamp".
attribute.name: type

tag.description: Creates a simple DataSource suitable only for prototyping.
tag.name: setDataSource

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable for the data source specified. Type can be String or DataSource.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: If var is specified, scope of the exported variable. Otherwise, scope of the data source configuration variable.
attribute.name: scope

attribute.description: Data source. If specified as a string, it can either be a relative path to a JNDI resource, or a JDBC parameters string as defined in Section 10.1.1.
attribute.name: dataSource

attribute.description: JDBC parameter: driver class name.
attribute.name: driver

attribute.description: JDBC parameter: URL associated with the database.
attribute.name: url

attribute.description: JDBC parameter: database user on whose behalf the connection to the database is being made.
attribute.name: user

attribute.description: JDBC parameter: user password
attribute.name: password

validator.description: Provides validation features for JSTL XML tags.

tag.name: choose
tag.description: Simple conditional tag that establishes a context for mutually exclusive conditional operations, marked by <when> and <otherwise>

tag.name: out
tag.description: Like <%= ... >, but for XPath expressions.

tag.name: if
tag.description: XML conditional tag, which evalutes its body if the supplied XPath expression evalutes to 'true' as a boolean

tag.name: forEach
tag.description: XML iteration tag.

tag.name: otherwise
tag.description: Subtag of <choose> that follows <when> tags and runs only if all of the prior conditions evaluated to 'false'

tag.name: param
tag.description: Adds a parameter to a containing 'transform' tag's Transformer

tag.name: parse
tag.description: Parses XML content from 'source' attribute or 'body'

tag.name: set
tag.description: Saves the result of an XPath expression evaluation in a 'scope'

tag.name: transform
tag.description: Conducts a transformation given a source XML document and an XSLT stylesheet

tag.name: when
tag.description: Subtag of <choose> that includes its body if its expression evalutes to 'true'

validator.description: Provides validation features for JSTL XML tags.

tag.description: Simple conditional tag that establishes a context for mutually exclusive conditional operations, marked by <when> and <otherwise>
tag.name: choose

tag.description: Like <%= ... >, but for XPath expressions.
tag.name: out

attribute.description: XPath expression to be evaluated.
attribute.name: select

attribute.description: Determines whether characters <,>,&,'," in the resulting string should be converted to their corresponding character entity codes. Default value is true.
attribute.name: escapeXml

tag.description: XML conditional tag, which evalutes its body if the supplied XPath expression evalutes to 'true' as a boolean
tag.name: if

attribute.description: The test condition that tells whether or not the body content should be processed.
attribute.name: select

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable for the resulting value of the test condition. The type of the scoped variable is Boolean.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Scope for var.
attribute.name: scope

tag.description: XML iteration tag.
tag.name: forEach

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable for the current item of the iteration. This scoped variable has nested visibility. Its type depends on the result of the XPath expression in the select attribute.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: XPath expression to be evaluated.
attribute.name: select

attribute.description: Iteration begins at the item located at the specified index. First item of the collection has index 0.
attribute.name: begin

attribute.description: Iteration ends at the item located at the specified index (inclusive).
attribute.name: end

attribute.description: Iteration will only process every step items of the collection, starting with the first one.
attribute.name: step

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable for the status of the iteration. Object exported is of type javax.servlet.jsp.jstl.core.LoopTagStatus. This scoped variable has nested visibility.
attribute.name: varStatus

tag.description: Subtag of <choose> that follows <when> tags and runs only if all of the prior conditions evaluated to 'false'
tag.name: otherwise

tag.description: Adds a parameter to a containing 'transform' tag's Transformer
tag.name: param

attribute.description: Name of the transformation parameter.
attribute.name: name

attribute.description: Value of the parameter.
attribute.name: value

tag.description: Parses XML content from 'source' attribute or 'body'
tag.name: parse

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable for the parsed XML document. The type of the scoped variable is implementation dependent.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable for the parsed XML document. The type of the scoped variable is org.w3c.dom.Document.
attribute.name: varDom

attribute.description: Scope for var.
attribute.name: scope

attribute.description: Scope for varDom.
attribute.name: scopeDom

attribute.description: Deprecated. Use attribute 'doc' instead.
attribute.name: xml

attribute.description: Source XML document to be parsed.
attribute.name: doc

attribute.description: The system identifier (URI) for parsing the XML document.
attribute.name: systemId

attribute.description: Filter to be applied to the source document.
attribute.name: filter

tag.description: Saves the result of an XPath expression evaluation in a 'scope'
tag.name: set

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable to hold the value specified in the action. The type of the scoped variable is whatever type the select expression evaluates to.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: XPath expression to be evaluated.
attribute.name: select

attribute.description: Scope for var.
attribute.name: scope

tag.description: Conducts a transformation given a source XML document and an XSLT stylesheet
tag.name: transform

attribute.description: Name of the exported scoped variable for the transformed XML document. The type of the scoped variable is org.w3c.dom.Document.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: Scope for var.
attribute.name: scope

attribute.description: Result Object that captures or processes the transformation result.
attribute.name: result

attribute.description: Deprecated. Use attribute 'doc' instead.
attribute.name: xml

attribute.description: Source XML document to be transformed. (If exported by <x:set>, it must correspond to a well-formed XML document, not a partial document.)
attribute.name: doc

attribute.description: Deprecated. Use attribute 'docSystemId' instead.
attribute.name: xmlSystemId

attribute.description: The system identifier (URI) for parsing the XML document.
attribute.name: docSystemId

attribute.description: javax.xml.transform.Source Transformation stylesheet as a String, Reader, or Source object.
attribute.name: xslt

attribute.description: The system identifier (URI) for parsing the XSLT stylesheet.
attribute.name: xsltSystemId

tag.description: Subtag of <choose> that includes its body if its expression evalutes to 'true'
tag.name: when

attribute.description: The test condition that tells whether or not the body content should be processed
attribute.name: select
